description: Rear roof extension; installation of three rooflights to front roofslope.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s):

Application form; Block Plan (Drawing number: BV/0221/HHP5); Location Plan; Existing Plans (Drawing number: BV/0221/HHP1); Proposed Plans (Drawing number: BV/0221/HHP3); Propose Elevations (Drawing number: BV/0221/HHP4); Existing Elevations (Drawing number: BV/0221/HHP2)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), polices D1, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The hereby approved rooflights to the front roof slope shall be conservation style and lie flush with the roof and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
